glsa.title: Tremulous: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in Tremulous.

background.p: Tremulous is a team-based First Person Shooter game.

description.p: It has been reported that Tremulous includes a vulnerable version of the ioQuake3 engine (GLSA 200605-12, CVE-2006-2236).

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to connect to a malicious games server, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: Tremulous users should upgrade to the latest version:
Note: The binary version of Tremulous has been removed from the Portage tree.
